etymologies: late Middle English: from Latin pyxis, from Greek puxis ‘box’

definitions: the container in which the consecrated bread of the Eucharist is kept.
shortDefinitions: container in which consecrated bread of Eucharist is kept

definitions: (in the UK) a box at the Royal Mint in which specimen gold and silver coins are deposited to be tested annually at the trial of the pyx.
shortDefinitions: (in UK) box at Royal Mint in which specimen gold and silver coins are deposited to be tested annually at trial of pyx by members
